title: Trump’s Fair Banking Rule
sub_head: Pushing back against the left’s red-lining of unpopular industries.
body:
Progressives are pounding banks to stop lending to industries they dislike. So credit to Acting Comptroller of the Currency Brian Brooks for putting banks on notice that they can’t red-line industries merely because they’re politically unpopular.
The Dodd–Frank Act charges the Comptroller with ensuring “fair access to financial services, and fair treatment of customers” by nationally chartered banks. Democrats who wrote that law wanted to make sure banks didn’t deny services to a class of customers simply because they carry...
